title: Greek Couscous Salad Recipe
description: This Greek couscous salad with garbanzo beans, feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and olives is hearty and delicious. Perfect for a hot summer's day.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Pasta Salad Greek Pasta Salad Recipes Greek Couscous Salad 4.6 (136) 91 Reviews 22 Photos This hearty Greek couscous salad uses Israeli couscous. So delicious! Submitted by KenzieKook Updated on June 12, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 22 22 22 22 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 3 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 3 servings ½ cup water ¼ cup chicken broth 1 teaspoon minced garlic ½ cup pearl (Israeli) couscous 1 cup canned chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained ¼ cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes ¼ cup sliced Kalamata olives 2 tablespoons crumbled feta cheese 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar 1 ½ teaspoons lemon juice 1 teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Pour water and chicken broth into a saucepan; stir in the garlic and bring to a boil. Stir in pearl couscous, cover the pan, and remove from heat. Allow couscous to stand until water has been absorbed, about 5 minutes; fluff with a fork. Allow couscous to cool to warm temperature. Lightly toss couscous, chickpeas, sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese in a large serving bowl. To make the dressing: Mix white wine vinegar, lemon juice, oregano, and black pepper in a small bowl until well combined. Pour over couscous mixture; toss again to serve. I Made It Print 191 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Greek Couscous Salad 01 of 22 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 22 Photo by  LetiC 04/03/2022 This meal was so delicious, a new family favorite. 03 of 22 Photo by  Emily Tanner 04/12/2021 I can't say I love this recipe but it's okay. Used tri-color couscous because I already had it on hand. I used a full can of garbanzo beans rather than measuring out a cup. I didn't measure the feta, just added a bunch til it looked good. And I used vegetable broth instead of chicken because I don't eat meat. I'm not sure what I don't love about this honestly, but I don't think I'll make it again. 04 of 22 Photo by  Cynthia 08/29/2020 05 of 22 Photo by  Dan 01/09/2020 06 of 22 Photo by  Patricia Ann Smith Russell 09/12/2019 07 of 22 Photo by  bnfunk 04/21/2019 I tripled the recipe for meal prep. Added onions and cucumber. Don't worry too much about the quantity of liquids, I just kept adding 1/2 cup increments of water/broth until it was as fluffy as I wanted. One suggestion is to season the chick peas with cumin, paprika, and chile powder, then bake for 10 min. Overall super good. 08 of 22 Photo by  crxcross 01/27/2019 09 of 22 Photo by  Clare 08/21/2016 10 of 22 Photo by  Gloria 12/15/2015 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Minty Orzo Lentil and Feta Salad 84 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken and Orzo Salad In Red Pepper Cups 48 Ratings Whole Wheat Rotini Pasta Salad 8 Ratings Fig and Gorgonzola Israeli Couscous Salad 5 Ratings Pantry Pasta Salad 1 Rating Orzo with Feta, Cucumber and Tomato 8 Ratings Zesty Southern Pasta and Bean Salad 74 Ratings Pasta Chickpea Salad 35 Ratings Greek Pasta Salad with Shrimp, Tomatoes, Zucchini, Peppers, and Feta 165 Ratings Pool Party Pasta Salad 25 Ratings Pearl Couscous Salad 26 Ratings Black Bean and Couscous Salad 1,447 Ratings Chicken Fiesta Salad 705 Ratings Baked Beans from Scratch 150 Ratings Creamy Summer Pasta Salad with BelGioioso Shaved Parmesan 5 Ratings Quick Greek Pasta Salad with Steak 137 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: KenzieKook
instructions: Pour water and chicken broth into a saucepan; stir in the garlic and bring to a boil. Stir in pearl couscous, cover the pan, and remove from heat. Allow couscous to cool to warm temperature.;Lightly toss couscous, chickpeas, sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese in a large serving bowl.;To make the dressing: Mix white wine vinegar, lemon juice, oregano, and black pepper in a small bowl until well combined. Pour over couscous mixture; toss again to serve.
